intro: Geboscon tenellum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features opposite, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by spherical, smooth seed capsules. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Geboscon tenellum is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse ecological roles.
